body.p: Now that you are more familiar with the game, what do you think that the contestant should do?

multiple_choice.choice: Stay with the door that he or she had originally picked.
Switch to the other unchosen door.
Choose whichever door he or she wants to. It doesn't make a difference—each of the two doors has a 50 percent chance of having the prize behind it.

response.feedback: Even though it is difficult to "let go" of your original choice, it turns out that this is not the best strategy to take. Read on for an explanation.
Switching is indeed the best strategy. Can you figure out why this is the case? Read on for an explanation.

This is the intuition of most people. There are two doors. One hides a prize behind it and one doesn't, so the chances of winning are the same (50%) with either selection. But actually, this is not the best strategy. Read on for an explanation.
